item.title: TikTok 影响者利用八卦的力量挫败移民及海关执法局的搜捕行动
item.description:
视频警告执法突袭，提供避免被驱逐出境的提示。【原文：

Videos warn of law-enforcement raids, provide tips to avoid deportation.

】

item.title: 加密货币交易所 Kraken 称去年收入翻了一番多
item.description: 加密货币交易所 Kraken 一直希望成为一家上市公司，该公司表示，在去年创纪录的数字资产市场涨势中，其收入增长了一倍多。【原文：The crypto exchange Kraken, which has long-held aspirations of becoming a publicly-traded company, said revenue more than doubled during last year’s record-breaking digital asset market rally.】

item.title: 美联储最青睐的通胀指标在 2024 年末以微弱升势收官
item.description: 美联储首选的基本通胀指标在 12 月份依然低迷，这应支持今年进一步降低利率。【原文：The Federal Reserve’s preferred measure of underlying inflation remained muted in December, which should support further reductions in interest rates this year.】

item.title: 美国劳动力成本环比增幅为 2021 年以来最低
item.description: 美国第四季度劳动力成本增长较上年同期有所放缓，这让美联储政策制定者放心，工资压力正在逐步减小，不再是通胀的主要驱动因素。【原文：US labor cost growth cooled in the fourth quarter from a year earlier, reassuring Federal Reserve policymakers wage pressures are gradually diminishing and no longer a key driver of inflation.】

item.title: 雄心勃勃的小公司猎取大猎物，大胆并购浪潮卷土重来
item.description: 交易环境的改善正在鼓励一些小公司开始捕猎大得多的猎物。【原文：The improving environment for deals is encouraging some smaller firms to start hunting much larger prey.】

item.title: 加拿大经济在最后一季度回暖，增长 1.8%
item.description: 在一系列快速降息措施的推动下，加拿大经济在去年年底获得了增长，同时这个北方国家也在为特朗普政府威胁征收 25% 的关税做准备。【原文：The Canadian economy gained strength at the end of last year, fueled by a rapid series of interest-rate cuts, as the northern nation braces for the Trump administration’s threatened 25% tariffs.】

item.title: 美联储鲍曼希望在降息前取得更多通胀进展
item.description: 美联储理事米歇尔-鲍曼（Michelle Bowman）表示，在央行进一步降低利率之前，她希望看到在通胀方面取得更多进展，并质疑在经济强劲的情况下限制性政策的力度。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman said she wants to see additional progress on inflation before the central bank lowers interest rates further, and questioned how restrictive policy might be given the economy’s strength.】

item.title: 南非再次停电，结束了 Eskom 连续 10 个月的停电状态
item.description: 南非国有电力公司将自 3 月 26 日以来首次因发电设备故障而开始停电，从而结束了长达 10 个月的停电期。【原文：South Africa’s state-owned power utility will start power cuts for the first time since March 26 due to the breakdown of generation units, ending a 10-month break from the outages that both drew praise for the utility and raised suspicion.】

item.title: 德国通胀保持不变，支持欧洲央行谨慎加息
item.description: 德国通胀率依然高企，提醒欧洲中央银行在继续降息时仍需谨慎。【原文：German inflation remained elevated, reminding the European Central Bank that caution is still needed as it continues to lower interest rates.】

item.title: 亚马逊密西西比数据中心价格飙升 60% 至 160 亿美元
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）在密西西比（Mississippi）的大规模数据中心项目预计将比之前宣布的花费高出 60%，这凸显了人工智能基础设施成本的不断攀升。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is expected to spend 60% more than previously announced on a massive data center project in Mississippi, underscoring the escalating costs for artificial intelligence infrastructure.】

item.title: 供应担忧挥之不去，咖啡将迎来两个月来最大涨幅
item.description: 纽约阿拉比卡咖啡期货将创下自 11 月底以来的最大月度涨幅，市场关注的焦点是持续的供应短缺信号。【原文：Arabica coffee futures in New York were set for the biggest monthly gain since late November with the market focused on persistent signals of supply shortages.】

item.title: 德国商业银行宣布回购 4 亿欧元股票
item.description: 德国商业银行（Commerzbank AG）宣布回购价值高达 4 亿欧元（4.15 亿美元）的股票，作为支付去年利润 71% 的承诺的一部分。【原文：Commerzbank AG announced a share buyback worth as much as €400 million ($415 million) as part of a pledge to pay out 71% of last year’s profit.】

item.title: Blackstone 预计数万亿美元将从富人流向私人市场
item.description: Blackstone Inc.的一位高级常务董事表示，随着富裕个人有更多机会进入这个一度由机构投资者主导的行业，私募市场将迎来数万亿美元的资金流入。【原文：Private markets are set to see trillions of dollars of inflows as wealthy individuals gain greater access to an industry once dominated by institutional investors, according to a senior managing director at Blackstone Inc.】

item.title: Trafigura 和前首席运营官被瑞士法院判定犯有贿赂罪
item.description: Trafigura 及其一名前高管被瑞士法院判定犯有受贿罪，这对全球大宗商品贸易行业来说是一个具有里程碑意义的判决。【原文：Trafigura and one of its former top executives were convicted by a Swiss court on bribery charges, in a landmark decision for the global commodity trading industry.】

item.title: 欧洲零售商加大力度销售更多可持续食品
item.description: 含糖海带啤酒、罐装植物性即食食品或使用再生小麦农场的面粉制作的面包。这些都是本周伦敦一家高档 Fortnum & Mason 商店展示的一些 "崇尚自然 "的产品。【原文：Beer with sugar kelp, canned plant-based ready meals or bread made using flour from regenerative wheat farms. These were some of the “nature-minded” products being showcased at one of London’s upscale Fortnum & Mason stores this week.】

item.title: 走政治钢丝 荷兰酝酿调整银行奖金上限
item.description: 荷兰财政部正在考虑放宽该国对浮动薪酬的部分限制，此举可能旨在支持银行，同时寻求降低公众反弹的风险。【原文：The Dutch finance ministry is considering easing parts of the country’s limits on variable pay in a move that could be designed to support banks while seeking to mitigate the risk of a public backlash.】

item.title: 法国会议委员会就 2025 年预算法案达成协议
item.description: 法国立法者周五就 2025 年预算版本达成协议，为下周议会可能推翻政府的摊牌铺平了道路。【原文：French lawmakers on Friday reached a deal on a version of the 2025 budget, paving the way for a showdown in parliament next week that could topple the government.】

item.title: 一月份债券上涨，特朗普回归推动本月走势反转
item.description: 2025 年伊始，债券市场一片惶恐，但由于交易员们仍在观望唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税和移民政策将如何发展，国债本月出现上涨。【原文：For all the trepidation coursing through the bond market at the start of 2025, Treasuries are up on the month as traders remain on watch for how President Donald Trump’s tariff and immigration policies will develop.】

item.title: Charter 的宽带用户流失令有线电视雪上加霜
item.description: 在互联网接入市场竞争激烈的情况下，Charter Communications Inc. 第四季度流失了 17.7 万名宽带用户，情况比预期的要糟糕。【原文：Charter Communications Inc. lost 177,000 broadband subscribers in the fourth quarter, worse than expected amid a very competitive market for internet access.】

item.title: 特朗普在雪佛龙委内瑞拉许可证问题上面临艰难抉择
item.description:
如果总统撤销超级委员会的制裁豁免权，就有可能失去对付马杜罗的关键筹码。【原文：

The president risks losing key leverage against Maduro if he pulls the supermajor’s sanctions waiver.

】

item.title: 巴西失业率在 2024 年结束时有所上升，但仍然很低
item.description: 2024 年底，巴西的失业率略有上升，但仍接近历史最低水平，这使得巴西央行继续面临进一步提高利率的压力。【原文：Brazil’s jobless rate ticked up slightly at the end of 2024 while remaining near a record low, keeping pressure on the central bank to raise its interest rate further.】

item.title: 雪佛龙开始使用 "美国湾"，向特朗普致敬
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统下令美国重新命名墨西哥湾之后，雪佛龙公司开始在其收益材料中使用 "美国湾 "而不是 "墨西哥湾"。【原文：Chevron Corp. has begun using “Gulf of America” instead of “Gulf of Mexico” in its earnings materials after President Donald Trump ordered the US to rename it.】

item.title: Meta 的扎克伯格向 DeepSeek 发起挑战，其创新能力在竞争对手中遥遥领先
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们改版后的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，库尔特-瓦格纳（Kurt Wagner）撰文指出，一家中国初创公司以较低成本开发的人工智能模型的出现，可能会对 Meta Platforms Inc.【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our revamped daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Kurt Wagner writes that the emergence of an AI model developed at a lower cost by a Chinese startup might prove beneficial to Meta Platforms Inc.】

item.title: 丹麦将为海上风电提供补贴，以重振市场活力
item.description: 丹麦将为海上风电和绿色氢能项目提供国家补贴，因为在经历了一次失败的招标和关键基础设施的延误之后，丹麦正努力重振这个备受煎熬的市场。【原文：Denmark will offer state subsidies to offshore wind and green hydrogen projects as it seeks to revive a suffering market after a failed tender and delays to crucial infrastructure.】

item.title: 卢布交易员为关税前夕的剧烈波动做好准备
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）预计将启动第一波美国进口关税之前的几个小时里，交易员们正在为加元的过度波动进行定位。【原文：Traders are positioning for excessive volatility in the Canadian dollar, in the hours before President Donald Trump is expected to unleash his first wave of US import tariffs.】

item.title: 美国在全球经济排名中进一步拉开与中国的距离
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂（Chris Anstey），波士顿的一名经济学编辑，今天我们将关注最新的美国与中国国内生产总值（GDP）数据。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net，或通过 @economics 在 X 上与我们联系。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston, and today we’re looking at the latest US vs. China GDP figures. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net or get in touch on X via @economics. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉推动化肥厂出售，向哥伦比亚发起挑战
item.description: 委内瑞拉总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗（Nicolás Maduro）正在推进出售哥伦比亚一家重要化肥厂的计划，以期为该国濒临崩溃的经济增加收入，这使他与总统古斯塔沃-彼得罗（Gustavo Petro）形成了对立。【原文：Venezuela’s Nicolás Maduro is moving ahead with plans to sell a key fertilizer plant in Colombia in a quest to shore up revenue for his country’s ailing economy, squaring him against President Gustavo Petro.】

item.title: 芯片市场持续低迷，意法半导体裁员最高达 6
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，意法半导体公司（STMicroelectronics NV）正在考虑通过提前退休和自然减员的方式裁员多达约 6%，因为这家法意芯片制造商正面临着工业和汽车行业需求的长期低迷。【原文：STMicroelectronics NV is considering reducing its workforce by as much as about 6% through early retirements and attrition, according to people familiar with the matter, as the Franco-Italian chipmaker confronts a prolonged demand slump in the industrial and auto sectors.】

item.title: 拉美航空第四季度利润飙升，创下年度最高纪录
item.description: 拉塔姆航空公司第四季度的净收入比去年同期增长了两倍多，将其 2024 年的净收入推向了年度最高纪录。【原文：Latam Airlines’s net income more than tripled in the fourth quarter from the year earlier, pushing it’s net income for 2024 to an annual record.】

item.title: Hotelbeds 所有者 HBX 7.5 亿欧元西班牙首次公开募股数小时内售罄
item.description: 西班牙公司 HBX Group International Plc 在开始认购后数小时内就收到了投资者对其首次公开发行的所有股票的足够需求，这表明投资者对欧洲今年迄今为止最大的一次上市的胃口。【原文：Spanish firm HBX Group International Plc received enough demand from investors for all the shares in its initial public offering within hours after subscriptions opened, indicating appetite for Europe’s biggest listing of the year so far.】
